example.eg: Mary has made a new friend; a little girl called Abigail.
example.egtrans: 玛丽交到了新朋友，是个名叫阿比盖尔的小女孩。

example.eg: My brothers are called Paul, David and Brian.
example.egtrans: 我的兄弟们名叫保罗、戴维德和布莱恩。

example.eg: I'll call you tomorrow to see how you are.
example.egtrans: 我明天会给你打电话看看你情况怎样。

example.eg: Jim, your mom's calling you.
example.egtrans: 吉姆，你妈妈在叫你。

example.eg: He called the names on the list and we wrote them down.
example.egtrans: 他大声宣读列表上的名字，我们把名字记了下来。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 大声说出, 大声读出

example.eg: Call the next candidate, please.
example.egtrans: 请叫下一位候选人过来。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 召唤, 传唤, 请来

example.eg: If you don't want to write you can always call.
example.egtrans: 如果不想写信，你可以打电话。

example.eg: Wade was so loud that I could hear him calling even from far away.
example.egtrans: 韦德哭喊的声音太大了，以至于我老远就听得到。

example.eg: I received a call from my bank manager today.
example.egtrans: 今天我接到银行经理的电话。

example.eg: The baby's due in three weeks but we don't know what to call her.
example.egtrans: 宝宝还有三周就出生了，但我们还不知道该叫她什么。

example.eg: They heard a call outside the window.
example.egtrans: 他们听到窗外有人呼喊。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 呼喊, 呼叫, 叫声

example.eg: Joanna's call told us she was ready to go.
example.egtrans: 乔安娜发出的信号告诉我们她准备走了。

example.eg: The principal's call for action followed a number of problems at the school.
example.egtrans: 学校出现了许多问题后，校长站出来呼吁要有所作为。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 请求，要求，呼吁, 召唤，呼唤

example.eg: He felt the call to the priesthood after his visit to Lourdes.
example.egtrans: 他在朝拜卢尔德后，感受到神召唤他成为牧师。

example.eg: He received a call to appear before the High Court.
example.egtrans: 他收到传唤，要在高等法院出庭。

example.eg: You can hear the call of an owl from my bedroom.
example.egtrans: 从我的卧室能听到猫头鹰的叫声。

example.eg: The call of a wolf made him sit up in his tent.
example.egtrans: 狼的长啸声让他在帐篷中坐起。

example.eg: He blew his duck call and didn't have to wait long before one appeared.
example.egtrans: 他吹响哨子召唤鸭子，没过多久，一只鸭子便出现了。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 模仿（鸟、兽的）叫声的工具（如哨子）

example.eg: She only arrived fifteen minutes before the call time.
example.egtrans: 她只比彩排通知的时间早到了十五分钟。

example.eg: There's no call for tears. It was only a joke.
example.egtrans: 没必要流泪，这只是个玩笑。

example.eg: There's little call for typewriter repair these days.
example.egtrans: 现在打字机修理已经没有什么需求了。

dsense.name: call
dsense.guideword: (cards: demand to show hands) (扑克游戏)

example.eg: I made a call, and the other players had to reveal their cards.
example.egtrans: 我要求摊牌，其他玩家只好把自己的牌亮出来。

dsense.name: call
dsense.guideword: (poker: equal a bet) (德州扑克游戏)

example.eg: He made a call with an average hand but ended up winning the pot.
example.egtrans: 他拿到一手很一般的牌，却跟注，最后居然赢光了赌池里的所有赌注。

example.eg: Are you going to bid? It's your call.
example.egtrans: 你要叫牌吗？该你叫牌了。

example.eg: The player disagreed with the umpire's call.
example.egtrans: 那位运动员不服裁判判决。

example.eg: Buying calls is a popular strategy for investors.
example.egtrans: 对投资人来说，买入买权是一种很流行的投资策略。

example.eg: This is your final call for payment.
example.egtrans: 这是给你的最后一次催款通知。

example.eg: Canceling the event was a good call, given the weather.  Both these candidates would be perfect for the job, but we can only hire one of them; it's going to be a tough call.
example.egtrans: 考虑到天气状况，取消活动是正确的决定。

example.eg: The receptionist said I couldn't talk to the doctor right then, because she was out on a call.
example.egtrans: 接待员告诉我说，现在我不能和医生交谈，因为她出诊去了。

example.eg: I'll call tomorrow morning on the way to work.
example.egtrans: 我会在明早上班途中顺路拜访。

example.eg: It's my turn and I'm going to call.
example.egtrans: 轮到我了，我要叫牌。

dsense.name: call
dsense.guideword: (poker: equal a bet) (德州扑克游戏)

example.eg: Do you want to call or raise?
example.egtrans: 你想跟还是加？

example.eg: Is that an owl calling?
example.egtrans: 是猫头鹰在叫吗？

example.eg: They called upon her to find a solution to their problems.
example.egtrans: 他们要求她为他们的问题找出解决方案。

example.eg: Steve called to his wife to come and help him.
Would you like to be called in the morning?
The umpire called the ball out.
He called the grouse into the open.
The debt could be called at any moment.
How dare you call me a cheat!
I call it a scandal.
They've called a meeting for tomorrow morning.
The sea was calling him.
Union leaders called an end to the strike after two weeks.
The game was called due to the rain.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 中止, 暂停, 停止

example.eg: Let's call it three miles from here to there.

dsense.name: call [sth]⇒
dsense.guideword: (cards: demand to see a hand) (卡牌)

example.eg: After the third round, anyone may call the hand.

dsense.name: call [sth]
dsense.guideword: (poker: equal a bet) (德州扑克游戏)

example.eg: I'll call your ten and raise you ten.
In American pool, you have to call your shot before you play it.
example.egtrans: 在美国的台球比赛中，你必须在击球前报袋。

example.eg: When the bleeding did not stop, a trip to the hospital was called for.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 恰当的，适宜的, 被需要的，有必要的

example.eg: Your comment about your neighbor's wife was not called for.
Solar energy is a clean form of electricity, so called because we gather it from the sun.
This so called teacher has no skills at all!
